intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. hirtella, commonly known as hairy eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported eye health benefits and is often used in herbal teas and tinctures.
